title: Hello World
content:
Welcome to ngx-Dumblog!

An simple and dumb (really dumb) blog front-end for the GitHub Pages service.

- First of all, you won't be able to run this locally, because of the CORS settings of most browsers. Maybe IE would let you do it.
- In the configs.json file you will find some settings like the 'About' modal text, blog name and how many posts to load on the home page.
- There's also the default favicon, which you can change.
- Included in .github.io/editor is the editor called Canvas, based on the CK Editor.
- To publish to GitHub Pages you just need to commit to your .github.io repo the files generated in the /dist folder of the Dumblog repo. They come ready to publish.
- You don't need to rebuild anything with Angular. Just modify the configs.json and go forth!

And I guess that's it! Happy blogging!
